CSCI-UA.60-1: Database Design and Web Implementation                     Home   Syllabus   Assignments   Readings   Resources     RESOURCES:          CSS, xHTML and Unix || Excel || Database Design || MySQL || PHP || SQLite || MongoDB / NoSQL        General       For class discussion 5/9/2013 http://www.evanmiller.org/how-not-to-sort-by-average-rating.html      MongoDB and NoSQL       Introduction to working with MongoDB on i6          Mongodb - http://www.mongodb.org/    Mongodb - manual - http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/    Mongodb - query selectors - http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/operator/    Mongodb - Geospatial Query operators - http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/operator/query-geospatial/          Tutorials for MongoDB          Tutorial - http://net.tutsplus.com/tutorials/databases/getting-started-with-mongodb/    w3 resources - http://www.w3resource.com/mongodb/introduction-mongodb.php    CSPAN step-by-step tutorial - http://search.cpan.org/dist/MongoDB/lib/MongoDB/Tutorial.pod    History of NoSQL http://www.w3resource.com/mongodb/nosql.php          Library book at the Bobst (available online):    The Definitive Guide to MongoDB: The NoSQL Database for Cloud and Desktop Computing online at the Bobst    by  Eelco Plugge, Peter Membrey and Tim Hawkins    Apress © 2010 (329 pages) Citation ISBN:9781430230519           JSON       JSON http://www.json.org/    BSON http://bsonspec.org    To make the code "beautiful: http://jsbeautifier.org/         SQLite and Python       SQLite    Python and SQLite documentation    SQLite Wrappers         PHP, HTML, xHTML, CSS, and Php/MySQL:       Using PHP on i6.cims.nyu.edu         Tutorial on HTML forms: http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_forms.asp    Reference site on PHP    Tutorials on PhP: http://www.thescripts.com/serversidescripting/php/       PHP and MySQL Together ("LAMP" applications)     MySQL functions in PHP (reference) http://php.net/manual/en/ref.mysql.php   Tutorial on PHP and MySQL : http://www.w3schools.com/PHP/php_mysql_intro.asp   MySQL and Facebook: http://www.readwriteweb.com/hack/2010/11/facebook-mysql-scale.php        MySQL       Using MySQL on i6.cims.nyu.edu          The "official" MySQL site: http://www.mysql.com/ and its documentation: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/    Complete manual; Chapter 3- Tutorial; Chapter 11 - DataTypes; Chapter 12 - Functions & Operators and Chapter 13- SQL Statement Syntax  (Note: We are using Version 5.1.34 on i6.cims.nyu.edu) - See http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/    MySQL functions: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/functions.html         Date formats - Note that MySQL stores dates and timestamps in one format only: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss; use the DATE_FORMAT() function within the query to modify the result: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/date-and-time-functions.html#function_date-format           W3Schools SQL tutorial          MySQLInnoDB Storage Engine - http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/innodb-storage-engine.html          For your reference (not required for this class) - Additional installations (Please note however that all assignments must be submitted for use on i6.cims.nyu.edu. )          MAMP - Mac, Apache, MySQL, PHP - development environment - http://www.mamp.info/en/index.html    XAMPP - Apache web server, MySQL, PHP, Perl, a FTP server and phpMyAdmin - http://sourceforge.net/projects/xampp/    WAMP - Web development platform on Windows - http://www.wampserver.com/en/          For Class discussion on database / query optimization          see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Query_optimization and http://www.sql-performance-tuning.com/oracle-sql-performance-tuning/          Additional sites of interest:          a list of JOINs in Oracle - http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/queries006.htm    using subqueries (or "nested queries") in Oracle - http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/queries007.htm#i2067858        Database Design     "Deep Training" Summary   Open Office - http://www.openoffice.org/ (downloads: http://www.openoffice.org/download/ )        Excel and VBA:      Macros in Excel http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/excel-help/about-macros-in-excel-HP005201201.aspx   Creating custom functions in Excel http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/excel-help/create-custom-functions-in-excel-2007-HA010218996.aspx         Financial data on the web for class and student exercises:       New York Federal Reserve http://www.newyorkfed.org/research/banking_research/datasets.html   St Louis Federal Reserve http://research.stlouisfed.org/fred2/   Bloomberg: Exchange data http://www.bloomberg.com/markets/stocks/movers_index_spx.html   Historical finance data on Yahoo http://finance.yahoo.com/q/hp?s=SPY+Historical+Prices       Additional Data Sources:   Note: There are many rich data sources available to you on-line through the Bobst Library; please do not hesitate to consult with any of the Subject Librarians for assistance ( http://library.nyu.edu/research/lib_arc.html )       The U.S. Senate Website: an example of sorts & filters   World Population Statistics data table for examples of ranking at http://www.census.gov/population/international/data/countryrank/rank.php   Consumer Price Index: http://www.bls.gov/news.release/cpi.toc.htm   US Agricultural Data: http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products.aspx   Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/surveys.htm   Baseball statistics   Weather Statistics - http://www.giss.nasa.gov /   New York City - https://nycopendata.socrata.com/ and MTA Developer Resources - http://mta.info/developers/   MusicBrainz - music encyclopedia - http://musicbrainz.org/         CSS , xHTML and UNIX   On-line resources and Tutorials:       CSS Tutorial ... List of CSS Properties and Values    HTML tutorial    Adobe's Dreamweaver CSS Tutorial    CSS Examples from Zen Garden    CSS Colors supported by major browsers and border styles       Text Editors and Debugging Tools:       BBEdit - http://www.barebones.com/products/bbedit/ (approximately $50 at the academic price)    Text Wrangler - http://www.barebones.com/products/textwrangler/    Notepad ++ for Windows - http://sourceforge.net/projects/notepad-plus/    Firebug (to use with Firefox) - http://getfirebug.com/    CSS Validator     xHTML Validator       Unix , i6.cims.nyu.edu and General:        i6.cims.nyu.edu - home page    Unix chmod command - explanation and notes; and reading a Unix file listing    Unix systems Administration: http://www.washington.edu/R870/    Unix Tutorial: http://www.ee.surrey.ac.uk/Teaching/Unix/                NYU / Dept of Computer Science - Prof Deena Engel / Spring, 2013

DataTypes; Chapter 12 - Functions & Operators and Chapter 13- SQL Statement Syntax  (Note: We are using Version 5.1.34 on i6.cims.nyu.edu) - See http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/    MySQL functions: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/functions.html         Date formats - Note that MySQL stores dates and timestamps in one format only: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss; use the DATE_FORMAT() function within the query to modify the result: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/date-and-time-functions.html#function_date-format           W3Schools SQL tutorial          MySQLInnoDB Storage Engine - http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/innodb-storage-engine.html          For your reference (not required for this class) - Additional installations (Please note however that all assignments must be submitted for use on i6.cims.nyu.edu. )          MAMP - News & Events    Partnerships    Research    Opportunities    Moore-Sloan    Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU    Data Science Showcase    Data Science Lunch Seminar Series    Data Science Incubator       Programs & Admissions       MS Programs    Overview    Curriculum    Non-Degree Program    Faculty & Staff    Admissions    Requirements    Careers in Data Science    Apply    Frequently Asked Questions       Current Students       Welcome    Registration Information    Student Resources    Course Grid    Course Pages    Important Dates    Student Profiles    Current Student Questions       Contact Us                                          NYU Center for Data Science                                                                                                                                                   April 8, 2015                                                               Why Apple Had To Take The NoSQL Plunge                                                                                                              Apple has quietly—and not so quietly—been buying up Big Datacompanies over the past few years, most recently acquiring FoundationDB but in 2013 also purchasing Acunu, maker of a real-time analytics platform. The intent seems to be to purchase data infrastructure talent—and very particular talent at that.   Basically, Apple needed to get into NoSQL database technology in a bad way. These alternatives to traditional relational databases (long known as SQL systems) offer speed and flexibility that older-style databases can only dream of.
